comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@adamdriscoll**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! You've already signed the contribution license agreement. Thanks!

The agreement was validated by Microsoft and real humans are currently evaluating your PR.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Does cmake still get installed in the 64-bit PF dir if you run the build bootstrap from an x86 prompt?  Also, that env var won't be defined on 32-bit Windows, right?   Hey, it's been a while since I've run 32-bit Windows.  Are builds on 32-bit Windows supposed to be supported?

comments.author: adamdriscoll
comments.body: Yep. It does get installed to x86 if run from x86 prompt. So ProgramW6432 would not actually work.

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: There are no 32bit packages that have been released (& who still runs the 32bit console anyway?) so I would think that it's not a supported Architecture

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: Our overall long term goal is to enable PowerShell on every platform supported by CoreCLR. Right now, we just produce x64 packages, but should be able to generate x86 packages with a few tweaks to the build script. The Wow scenario (x86 binaries on x64 system) is a non-goal at this time unless there is HUGE demand for it.

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body:
Update: I spun up an x86 VM and confirmed that the x86 version of CMake installs to ${env:ProgramFiles}\CMake\bin on that system. 

This change LGTM
